overview: Billy Connolly was, in the 1970s, a sort of Scottish Lenny Bruce, who, with devastating humour, sliced through the hypocrisies he perceived. This 1976 documentary follows the singer-comic during his 1975 Irish tour. Made in a cinema verit√© fashion, the performer appears to be completely unaware of the presence of the camera in his off-stage and backstage moments.
title: Billy Connolly: Big Banana Feet
